page.title: 11Fruit Farming in Lamberhurst
page.content: Lamberhurst is in the{Weald of Kent which is often called{The Garden of {England. Many of the farms in this area specialise in{fruit.}Copthall Farm's 29 acres are made up of 8 acres of strawberries, 5 acres of woodland, 2 acres of each of runner beans and raspberries, with the remainder lying fallow. 2 full time workers are employed, with 20 more at picking time. Most farms have{apple}orchards. The large well-spaced trees that need ladders to reach their tops at pruning and harvest times are being replaced by rows of small trees on dwarfing stock. Many more trees are planted per acre and trained by tying on to wires. The number of{cherry}trees is dwindling, but{pears}are becoming more widely grown.
